title: How to Make Beer Taste Better

steps.headline: Pour a glass of beer.
steps.description: Leave extra room for the addition of other ingredients.

steps.headline: Select the ingredients.
steps.description: This article can work in two ways. You can either stop at the addition of a single ingredient, or you can stop after adding several or all of the ingredients. It depends on your personal taste preferences but it's probably worth trying working through the whole list of ingredient additions at least once, to see if you like it!

steps.headline: Cut a lime in half and squeeze the juice from both halves into the empty glass.
Pour the beer from its glass into the glass of lime juice.
steps.description: Be sure to pour the beer slowly and slightly tilt the cup while pouring to prevent foaming. You can stop at this point and enjoy the lime-laced beer, or keep going. If stopping here, stir gently.

steps.headline: Add a pinch of salt to the beer and lime juice mix.
steps.description: Either stop here, or keep going. If stopping here, stir gently.

steps.headline: Pour the clamato, tomato juice or V8/vegetable juice, whichever is preferred, into the glass of beer and lime juice mix.
steps.description: Either stop here, or keep going. If stopping here, stir gently.

steps.headline: Add hot sauce for spicy taste.
steps.description: The amount of hot sauce you use depends on the amount of spice (fiery heat) preferred. This step is definitely optional but really gives the beer a lift!

steps.headline: Stir lightly and serve the ultimate new beer.

tyn: 2 beer glasses (or more if friends are over)
Stirring implement, such as a swizzle stick or a long-handled spoon
